Package builder.constraints.states

Class NodeState

  • java.lang.Object
    • builder.constraints.states.NodeState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Allocable, Freeable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StateAllDiff, StateAmong, StateGCC, StateProduct, StateProductRelaxed, StateSubset, StateSum, StateSumDouble, StateSumDoubleULP, StateSumRelaxed
    public abstract class NodeState
extends java.lang.Object
implements Allocable
    NodeState
    Abstract class representing the state of a constraint.

      abstract NodeState createState​(int label, int layer, int size)
      Transition function.
      Create a new state according to the label of the arc, the layer of the PARENT node and the size of the DD.
      abstract java.lang.String hash​(int label, int layer, int size)
      Signature function.
      Two nodes are merged when their signature are the same.
      Signature hash​(int label, int layer, int size, boolean test)
      Signature function (TESTING).
      Two nodes are merged when their signature are the same.
      abstract boolean isValid​(int label, int layer, int size)
      Validity check.
      Check if the new state according to the transition function is a valid state of the constraint prior to its creation.
      NodeState merge​(NodeState state, int label, int layer, int size)
      Merge function.
      This function is called when the constraint is relaxed.
      When two nodes have the same signature (hash), they are merged : however, when the constraint is relaxed, the states might not be the same.

    • Method Detail

      • createState

        public abstract NodeState createState​(int label,
                                      int layer,
                                      int size)
        Transition function.
        Create a new state according to the label of the arc, the layer of the PARENT node and the size of the DD.
        Parameters:
        label - Label of the arc
        layer - The index of the PARENT's layer
        size - The total size of the DD
        Returns:
        The new state according to the transition

      • isValid

        public abstract boolean isValid​(int label,
                                int layer,
                                int size)
        Validity check.
        Check if the new state according to the transition function is a valid state of the constraint prior to its creation.
        Parameters:
        label - Label of the arc
        layer - The index of the PARENT's layer
        size - The total size of the DD
        Returns:
        True if the new state is valid, false otherwise

      • merge

        public NodeState merge​(NodeState state,
                       int label,
                       int layer,
                       int size)
        Merge function.
        This function is called when the constraint is relaxed.
        When two nodes have the same signature (hash), they are merged : however, when the constraint is relaxed, the states might not be the same. Therefore, we need to define a merge.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to merge this state with
        label - Label of the arc
        layer - The index of the PARENT's layer
        size - The total size of the DD
        Returns:
        The result of the merging of the states

      • hash

        public abstract java.lang.String hash​(int label,
                                      int layer,
                                      int size)
        Signature function.
        Two nodes are merged when their signature are the same.
        Parameters:
        label - Label of the arc
        layer - The index of the PARENT's layer
        size - The total size of the DD
        Returns:
        The signature of the state
